name: Besan Ladoo
history: Besan Ladoo is a traditional Indian sweet made with gram flour. It's a popular treat across India, especially during festivals and celebrations.
description: Besan Ladoo is made from gram flour (besan) roasted in ghee, sweetened with sugar, and shaped into small round balls. These sweets are known for their rich, nutty flavor and melt-in-the-mouth texture.

instructions.title: Roast the Gram Flour
instructions.description: In a heavy-bottomed pan, roast the gram flour in ghee on a low flame until it turns golden brown and emits a nutty fragrance. Allow it to cool.

instructions.title: Add Sugar and Spices
instructions.description: Once the roasted flour has cooled, add powdered sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well.

instructions.title: Shape the Ladoos
instructions.description: Take a small portion of the mixture and shape it into round balls. If the mixture is too dry, add a little more ghee.

instructions.title: Garnish
instructions.description: Garnish each ladoo with chopped nuts.

instructions.title: Serve or Store
instructions.description: Serve the Besan Ladoos immediately or store them in an airtight container.

tips: Roasting the gram flour properly is key to getting the right flavor.
Adjust the amount of ghee to get the desired consistency.
variations: Add dry fruits like raisins or chopped dates to the mixture for added texture.
Try using jaggery instead of sugar for a different taste.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored for up to 2 weeks.
storage.instructions: Keep in an airtight container at room temperature.

reheatingInstructions: Besan Ladoos do not require reheating. Enjoy them at room temperature.
presentationTips: Arrange ladoos on a decorative plate or tray.
Garnish with silver leaf (varak) for a festive look.
